Lore: "What was that?" The Jedi power known as "affect mind" is often used to create minor distractions, allowing Jedi to elude enemies rather than engage them in battle.
Gametext: Plays on table. Bad Feeling Have I is canceled. Unless Inner Strength on table, opponent may use only one combat card per turn. Let Them Make The First Move may target only Undercover spies and R2-D2
Counterpart: I Find Your Lack Of Faith Disturbing (V) - Defensive Shield

Lore: Death Star troopers on sentry duty observe and direct incoming starships and monitor other critical sites. They perform sensor scans for life forms and weapons.
Gametext: Plays on table. Colo Claw Fish is canceled. Opponent must first use X Force to deploy a non-unique card (except a Jawa) to a location, where X = the number of copies of that card at that location.

Lore: "About twenty guns. Some on the surface, some on the towers."
Gametext: Plays on table. If opponent moves from a location you occupy during your turn (unless 'moving through' the location), they lose 2 Force. At end of opponent's turn, if you control two battlegrounds (a site and system) and opponent deployed a card with ability and did not initiate a battle, may retrieve 1 Force.
Information: Article at DeckTech, November 1st, 2005\par Top 5 Damage-Controlling V-Cards (Dark Side) by Armaedes and Shewski\par \par Much ballyhooed when first released, these "offensive" Defensive Shields became a popular staple among most Shield lists. It's very easy to play since its initiation conditions are similar to another standby, Battle Order/Plan. These shields work to discourage cowardly play, like running away from battles on your turn (Watch out for Honor reducing this!) or not fighting you when they deploy to the table. Many decks have been built so that they can take full advantage of this gametext. [...]\par \par ARMAEDES' TAKE:\par Excellent choice, this was actually #6 on my list. It barely missed the cut because the second portion of the text requires that you control a site and a system to make it work, and hardcore battling decks rarely do this. The part of the card that makes the opponent lose Force can be good, but frankly if your opponent has a choice between taking a beating and losing a measley two cards (which, as you point out, is reduced by Honor Of The Jedi), they're going to lose the 2 no questions asked. In other words, those this is a card that should be played in every battling deck, it doesn't actually help your big battles happen because the opponent is still able to use their "escape" cards, they just have to lose a couple of Force to do so - which oftentimes is a fair trade.
Combo: Firepower (V) + Ability, Ability, Ability\par During opponent's deploy phase, opponent must choose to deploy a card with ability or lose 2 Force.\par -----\par Firepower (V) - Defensive Shield + Set Your Course For Alderaan/The Ultimate Power In The Universe
Rules: (Errata) The game text '(unless 'moving through' the location)' added.

CardName: I Find Your Lack Of Faith Disturbing (V)
Lore: Darth Vader ruthlessly used the Force to strike down enemies and soldiers who displeased him. He could choke victims from afar without touching them.
Gametext: Plays on table. Goo Nee Tay is canceled. Unless Deep Hatred on table, opponent may use only one combat card per turn. We'll Handle This may target only Undercover spies and 5D6-RA-7.

Lore: The X-wing's display panel allows for different firing patterns for different weapons. This gives the pilot the ability to switch weapon types with minimum time and energy loss.
Gametext: Plays on table. Whenever opponent excludes any character(s) from battle, they lose 2 Force. At end of opponent's turn, if you control two battlegrounds (a site and a system) and opponent deployed a card with ability and did not inititate a battle, you may retrieve 1 Force.

Lore: Rebel sentries are stationed on raised sensor platforms. On watch for Imperial scouts and other hazards, they supplement data gathered by Yavin Base's main sensors.
Gametext: Plays on table. Colo Claw Fish is canceled. Opponent must first use X Force to deploy a non-unique card (except a Jawa or Tusken Raider) to a location, where X = the number of copies of that card at that location.

Lore: "Give yourself to the dark side. It is the only way you can save your friends."
Gametext: Plays on table. If an 'insert' card was just inserted or revealed, it is canceled. You lose no Force to Boonta Eve Podrace. While you occupy more battlegrounds than opponent, I Did It! is suspended.
Counterpart: Your Insight Serves You Well (V) - Defensive Shield
Cancels: any 'insert' card:\par 3,720 to 1\par A Disturbance In The Force\par A Tremor In The Force\par Access Denied\par Anger, Fear, Aggression\par Knowledge And Defense\par Never Tell Me The Odds\par Restricted Access

Lore: Imperial officers aboard the Death Star considered the Rebellion a minor threat.
Gametext: Plays on table unless A Useless Gesture on table.. In order to play an Interrupt from Lost Pile, opponent must first stack it here (if possible) and use +1 Force for each card here, even if Interrupt is normally free. Revolution is canceled.

Lore: The Boonta Eve crowds are always looking for new and exciting developments at every Podrace.
Gametext: Plays on table. Cancels Order To Engage and Scramble. Once per game, may take an Immediate Effect into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While opponent occupies no battleground systems, Staging Areas is suspended. "Missing" on Lost In The Wilderness is treated as "landspeed = 0 for remainder of turn."
Pulls: After Her!\par Alert My Star Destroyer!\par All Too Easy\par Breached Defenses\par Cane Adiss\par Despair\par Energy Walls\par Enter The Bureaucrat\par Frozen Dinnerg\par High Anxiety\par I Am Your Father\par Imperial Propaganda\par Lost In Space\par Mostly Armless\par Mournful Roar\par Pride Of The Empire\par Qui-Gon's End\par Tentacle\par There'll Be Hell To Pay
Counterpart: Don't Do That Again (V) - Defensive Shield
Cancels: Order To Engage\par Scramble\par Suspends Staging Areas while opponent occupies no battleground systems.

Lore: The Jedi won't tolerate silly behavior for very long.
Gametext: Plays on table. Once per game may take any Immediate Effect into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While opponent occupies no battleground systems, Mobilization Points is suspended. "Missing" on Always Thinking With Your Stomach is treated as "landspeed = 0 for remainder of turn."
Pulls: A Gift\par A Vergence In The Force\par Advantage\par At Peace\par Descent Into The Dark\par Disarming Creature\par \Energy Walls\par Grappling Hook\par Heroic Sacrifice\par I Can't Believe He's Gone\par Imperial Atrocity\par Legendary Starfighter\par The Time For Our Attack Has Come\par They Win This Round\par Weapon Of A Fallen Mentor\par What Was It?\par What're You Tryin' To Push On Us?

Gametext: Plays on table. While you have 12 or fewer cards in hand, opponent may not remove cards from your hand (except with Monnok). Once per turn (even at start of turn), target a [Coruscant] Politcal Effect; it is suspended for remainder of the turn.
Information: Can use either Coruscant or Reflections III card under the v-slip.
Counterpart: Wipe Them Out, All Of Them - Defensive Shield

Gametext: Plays on table. While you occupy a battleground and opponent occupies less than two battlegrounds, cancel opponent's Force drains at non-battleground locations and opponent's Force retrieval.
Information: Original card: You Will Take Me To Jabba Now
Cancels: Opponent's Force drains at non-battlegrounds\par Opponent's Force retrieval

Lore: Luke knew that while the dark side was quicker and more seductive, eventually evil would turn on itself.
Gametext: Plays on table. Scanning Crew is canceled. If an 'insert' card was just inserted or revealed, it is canceled. You lose no Force to Boonta Eve Podrace. While you occupy three battlegrounds, Watto's Box is suspended.
Information: Can use either Death Star II or Reflections III card under the v-slip.
Counterpart: You Cannot Hide Forever (V) - Defensive Shield
Cancels: Scanning Crew\par any 'insert' card:\par 3,720 to 1\par A Disturbance In The Force\par A Tremor In The Force\par Access Denied\par Anger, Fear, Aggression\par Knowledge And Defense\par Never Tell Me The Odds\par Restricted Access

Gametext: Plays on table. While you have 12 or fewer cards in hand, opponent may not remove cards from your hand (except with Grimtaash).  Once per turn (even at start of turn), target a [Coruscant] Political Effect; it is suspended for the remainder of the turn.
Play on table. For opponent to deploy a character, starship, or vehicle for free (except by that card's own game text), opponent must first use 2 force.
Plays on table. For opponent to deploy a character, starship or vehicle for free (except by that card's own game text), opponent must first use 2 force.
Information: Primarily this card is designed to hinder (not kill) these strategies:\par \par Blizzard 4 pulling Vader\par Free Executor\par Free Maul to the Landing site\par Jabba's Space Cruiser reacts\par -----\par Good against the Watto-Objective No Money, No Parts, No Deal! / You're A Slave?\par -----\par Player Created Card\par Original concept by Michael Pistone, Kashyyyk Regional Winner 2004.

Lore: Han was not sure if Lando had forgiven him for winning the \ul Millennium Falcon\ul0. As the old gamblers' saying about sabacc goes: "Win the game, lose a friend."
Gametext: Plays on table. Cancels A Dangerous Time and Imperial Supply. Each player may play only one card with "sabacc" in title each turn. You may cancel an opponent's card with "sabacc" in title by losing 1 Force from hand.
